solution_line_template: Jose can earn ${charge_per_kid} x {num_kids_per_day} = $<<{charge_per_kid}*{num_kids_per_day}={earnings_per_day_kids}>>{earnings_per_day_kids} per day for kids.
So, he can earn ${charge_per_adult} x {num_adults_per_day} = $<<{charge_per_adult}*{num_adults_per_day}={earnings_per_day_adults}>>{earnings_per_day_adults} per day for adults.
Jose earns ${earnings_per_day_adults} + ${earnings_per_day_kids} = $<<{earnings_per_day_adults}+{earnings_per_day_kids}={total_earnings_per_day}>>{total_earnings_per_day} per day for kids and adults.
Therefore, he can earn ${total_earnings_per_day} x {days_per_week} = $<<{total_earnings_per_day}*{days_per_week}={total_earnings_per_week}>>{total_earnings_per_week} per week.
